**Version Number:** 9.3.22-1-staging
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176922/test-cases/41237524
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome
**App Component:** Search

## Action Performed:
Precondition: User has a workspace.

1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com
2. Sign in. Navigate to the workspace chat.
3. Click on +, Add attachment, attach a video in .mp4 format.
4. In LHN, navigate to Reports > Chats.
5. Click the attached video, click expand, then click Download from the top right corner.

## Expected Result:
Downloaded video attachments should retain their original format and be playable.

## Actual Result:
Downloaded video attachments have a corrupted format.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Report - System message generated for merchant rules not seen for track expense submitted to WS

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Hourly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.22.0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82438
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace with rules enabled.
Prerequisite 2: Account has Self DM.
1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website.
2. Navigate to "Workspace" > "Rules"
3. Scroll down to "Merchant Rules" and select "Add Merchant Rule"
4. Add any merchant in "For expenses with"
5. Add any category and description in "Apply these updates" and save the rule.
6. Navigate to Self DM.
7. Create a manual expense with merchant added in step 4.
8. Tap on "Submit to someone" and select workspace where rule were created.
9. Submit the expense without adding any category or description.
10. Navigate to workspace chat and open expense report.
11. Note that "Category" and "Description" fields were updated via created merchant rule.
12. Note that "Set the category to "XX" and description to "XX" via workspace rules" system message is not displayed.

## Expected Result:
System generated message showing that category and description were updated via workspace rules, should be displayed when a track expense is submitted to workspace.

## Actual Result:
System generated message showing that category and description were updated via workspace rules, is not displayed for track expenses submitted to workspace, despite fields being correclty updated. System message only appear when expense is created directly in workspace chat.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Action Performed:

1. Open a report in Old Dot (OD)
2. Reject the report
3. Add a reason in the reject comment modal
4. Confirm the comment appears in the report comments in OD
5. Open the same report in New Expensify (ND)
6. Check the report comments

## Expected Result:
The reject comment added in OD should sync and appear in the report comments in ND.
Report comment history should remain consistent across OD and ND.
## Actual Result:
The reject comment appears in OD.
The same comment does not appear in ND.
## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Set up Sentry release size analysis

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem
When we deploy App, if new packages are added or updated, then we can introduce start time regressions due to unexpected changes in bundle size.

### Solution
Set up Sentry's [size analysis](https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/react-native/size-analysis/) feature with our deploy pipelines (for iOS/Android, staging/production/AdHoc).

**Important Note:** Access to Sentry is a prerequisite for this issue. Please do not post a proposal if you do not already have access to Expensify's Sentry dashboards.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @abzokhattab</details>

1. User logs into [new.expensify.com](http://new.expensify.com/)

labels.name: External

labels.description: Reproducible steps needed

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @jowennlucero 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1771433614057769)

## Action Performed:

1. In OldDot (OD), ensure cash expenses are set to Always Reimbursable
2. In ND, an admin attempts to trigger payment for a reimbursable report
3. The admin encounters the error: “Cannot reimburse report - This report doesn't have reimbursable expenses.”
4. In ND, the same report appears under Unapproved Cash, but the Reimbursable toggle is disabled
5. The admin must unapprove the report, re-enable the reimbursable option on the expense, and resubmit the report to proceed with reimbursement.

## Expected Result:
Settings from OD should carry over to ND. If cash expenses are configured as Always Reimbursable, they should remain reimbursable in ND without manual correction.
## Actual Result:
Reimbursable expenses are displayed as non-reimbursable in ND, causing reimbursement errors and additional manual steps for admins.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

3. Open workspace chat 
4. Go offline

9. Tap more - change workspace

Deleted expense must not be able to be  submitted, approved & change workspace.

Deleted expense can be submitted, approved & change workspace.

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.19-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** (Needs Reproduction) Transactions deleted when deleting card feed **Reproducible in production?:** 9Needs reproduction) **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @abbagail **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771362776213759) ## Action Performed: 1. Go to Reports > Accounting > Unapproved Card, or Reports > Accounting > Reconciliation (and update to Expensify Card, groupby:card) 2. See expenses that fall into that range 3. Feed column shows: "Deleted Feed." ## Expected Result: See "Expensify Card" or even "Expensify Card:workspace" ## Actual Result: "Deleted Feed" (This implies from help sources and AZ that the feed/connection is deactivated or removed and will no longer update. this is not accurate for Active Expensify Cards.) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The video for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771362776213759) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @jayeshmangwani
